f8aab983666f.title: There’s no real reason to filibuster Gorsuch.

paragraphs.text: There’s no real reason to filibuster Gorsuch. He won’t change the makeup of the court as he’ll be replacing Scalia. By deciding to avenge Garland, the Dems are throwing away the filibuster, which means that when one of the liberal justices shuffles off, and they’re faced with an awful appointment that might attract a Republican or two against cloture…

f4474af0fa31.title: I found this piece on facebook, and I appreciate how you showed your work in the google doc!

paragraphs.text: I found this piece on facebook, and I appreciate how you showed your work in the google doc! I was wondering though, how do you know that everyone in each state supports what their senator decided to do? Isn’t it possible that some of the people in red states would actually prefer to fillibuster as well? And, also, some people in blue states might support Gorsuch.

84a0c3f17748.title: First off, we don’t live in a democracy.

paragraphs.text: First off, we don’t live in a democracy. We never have. We have a representative form of government. Secondly, the senate was designed this way on purpose. Otherwise Montana would never have a voice in anything. And gerrymandering works both ways. It’s not an exclusive tool of republicans.

cd3a055bdd7b.title: For that, blame Wilson and the Dems of his day; they’re the ones who insisted on popular vote for…

paragraphs.text: For that, blame Wilson and the Dems of his day; they’re the ones who insisted on popular vote for Senators, rather than having the states’ legislatures designate them. But the 2 from each was again demanded in the Constitution, precisely to keep libs from overwhelming the votes and voices of other states.
paragraphs.name: c412

a1f67d24e0ae.title: Is there a single institution in our country that isn’t tailor-made to weight the votes of racists…

paragraphs.text: Is there a single institution in our country that isn’t tailor-made to weight the votes of racists and slave-owners’ descendants over the votes of the rest of the nation?

d62b527957af.title: True. But that’s how the Senate was set up, as a counterbalance to the proportionality of the House…

paragraphs.text: True. But that’s how the Senate was set up, as a counterbalance to the proportionality of the House. As a result this article falls short of a compelling argument, rather, it’s a passing “oh hey, that’s interesting” piece.

7ea82a214a5.title: And by being irresponsible and childish those Democrats will force the rule change that makes their…

paragraphs.text: And by being irresponsible and childish those Democrats will force the rule change that makes their crying meaningless. Gorsuch will be the next Justice but the real pain will come on Trump’s next nominee that will be way less mainstream and middle of the road than Gorsuch. Democrats are shooting themselves in the foot by rejecting Gorsuch, and they can’t even see it.
paragraphs.name: 7dff

d0d567a5f92f.title: American democracy is not supposed to give all of the power to the minority, yet, that’s exactly…

paragraphs.text: American democracy is not supposed to give all of the power to the minority, yet, that’s exactly what has happened. The House, Senate, and The Presidency all controlled by a minority of the vote.
